Guided.description: Specifies that the content of the decision table cell is restricted to values relevant to the data type of the table column's expression.
Guided.helpDescription: Specifies that the content of the decision table cell is restricted to values relevant to the data type of the table column's expression.

Text.description: Specifies that the content of the decision table cell receives all possible suggestions (relevant functions, attributes and values) that are relevant to the data type of the table column's expression.
Text.helpDescription: Specifies that the content of the decision table cell receives all possible suggestions (relevant functions, attributes and values) that are relevant to the data type of the table column's expression.

Both.description: Specifies that both rule formats are available in the decision table; allowing the rule creator to choose whether to formulate the decision table cells in either the basic or advanced format.
Both.helpDescription: Specifies that both rule formats are available in the decision table; allowing the rule creator to choose whether to formulate the decision table cells in either the basic or advanced format.

DecisionTable.description: Specifies that the rule is formulated as a table that allows complex rules to be visualized according to an if-then-else logic.
DecisionTable.helpDescription: Specifies that the rule is formulated as a table that allows complex rules to be visualized according to an if-then-else logic.

TextRule.description: Specifies that the rule is formulated as a single condition, which is written directly in a business language.
TextRule.helpDescription: Specifies that the rule is formulated as a single condition, which is written directly in a business language.

FirstMatch.description: Specifies that only the first condition that matches the input (the first matching row by order in the decision table) is returned as an output.
FirstMatch.helpDescription: Specifies that only the first condition that matches the input (the first matching row by order in the decision table) is returned as an output.

AllMatch.description: Specifies that all conditions that match the input (each matching row in the decision table) are returned as an output.
AllMatch.helpDescription: Specifies that all conditions that match the input (each matching row in the decision table) are returned as an output.

CellFormat.description:
Deprecated! Since undefined This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the attribute RuleFormat instead.
Specifies that the rendering of a cell is based on cellFormat and each cell can have a different format during rendering
CellFormat.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since undefined This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the attribute RuleFormat instead.
Specifies that the rendering of a cell is based on cellFormat and each cell can have a different format during rendering

DeprecatedInfo.description: This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the attribute RuleFormat instead.

RuleFormat.description: Specifies that the rendering is at the rule level. The value set here is applicable for all the cells in the rule.
RuleFormat.helpDescription: Specifies that the rendering is at the rule level. The value set here is applicable for all the cells in the rule.

DeprecatedInfo.description: This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the attribute RuleFormat instead.

All.description: Specifies that the expression can be of any of the supported business data types.
All.helpDescription: Specifies that the expression can be of any of the supported business data types.

TimeSpan.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a time difference in milliseconds.
TimeSpan.helpDescription: Specifies that the expression must represent a time difference in milliseconds.

Number.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a real number with or without dot-decimal notation.
Number.helpDescription: Specifies that the expression must represent a real number with or without dot-decimal notation.

Time.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a time only.
Time.helpDescription: Specifies that the expression must represent a time only.

String.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a single-quoted UTF-8 encoded string.
String.helpDescription: Specifies that the expression must represent a single-quoted UTF-8 encoded string.

Boolean.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a Boolean data type: true, false.
Boolean.helpDescription: Specifies that the expression must represent a Boolean data type: true, false.

Timestamp.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a date and timestamp.
Timestamp.helpDescription: Specifies that the expression must represent a date and timestamp.

Date.description: Specifies that the expression must represent a date only.
Date.helpDescription: Specifies that the expression must represent a date only.

expressionLanguage.description: Expression language to model English like expressions. Should not be used when sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLanguage is used.
expressionLanguage.helpDescription: Expression language to model English like expressions. Should not be used when sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLanguage is used.

astExpressionLanguage.description: Expression language to use DMN SFEEL for modelling expressions. Should not be used when sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage is used.
astExpressionLanguage.helpDescription: Expression language to use DMN SFEEL for modelling expressions. Should not be used when sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage is used.

sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder.description: The sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder control allows business users to create rules using a business language.
sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RuleBuilder control. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTypes types} : sap.rules.ui.RuleType[] (default: DecisionTable,TextRule)
    • {@link #getBindingContextPath bindingContextPath} : string
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getDecisionTableConfiguration decisionTableConfiguration} : sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration
    • {@link #getTextRuleConfiguration textRuleConfiguration} : sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration
  • Associations
    • {@link #getExpressionLanguage expressionLanguage} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage)
    • {@link #getAstExpressionLanguage astExpressionLanguage} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLanguage)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link Control#constructor Control} can be used as well.
sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder.helpDescription: The sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder control allows business users to create rules using a business language.

textRuleConfiguration.description: Configuration for rule of type 'Text Rule'.
textRuleConfiguration.helpDescription: Configuration for rule of type 'Text Rule'.

_ruleTypeSelector.description: Provides a combo box from which the user selects the rule type for the new rule. Only relevant if types contains more than one value.
_ruleTypeSelector.helpDescription: Provides a combo box from which the user selects the rule type for the new rule. Only relevant if types contains more than one value.

decisionTableConfiguration.description: Configuration for rule of type 'decision table'.
decisionTableConfiguration.helpDescription: Configuration for rule of type 'decision table'.

_rule.description: Rule created by the Rule Builder.
_rule.helpDescription: Rule created by the Rule Builder.

types.description: Available types that can be created using the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder control. If empty, all rule types will be available for selection. If only one type exists, the Rule Builder will open it automatically.
types.helpDescription: Available types that can be created using the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder control. If empty, all rule types will be available for selection. If only one type exists, the Rule Builder will open it automatically.

bindingContextPath.description: Path to a Rule object in the model data, which is used for the definition of relative context bindings inside the RuleBuilder control (mandatory). Example: "/Rules(Id='0050569181751ED683EFEEC6AA2B73C5',Version='000001')"
bindingContextPath.helpDescription: Path to a Rule object in the model data, which is used for the definition of relative context bindings inside the RuleBuilder control (mandatory). Example: "/Rules(Id='0050569181751ED683EFEEC6AA2B73C5',Version='000001')"

editable.description: Indicates whether or not the controls of the RuleBuilder are editable.
editable.helpDescription: Indicates whether or not the controls of the RuleBuilder are editable.

change.name: change
change.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLangu.description: Provides the AstExpressionLanguage service functionality, such as expression validations, expression parsing, auto-complete suggestions, retrieving expression metadata and tokens, and performing runtime services (fetching data objects, outputs, etc).
sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLangu.constructorDescription: Constructor for a new AstExpressionLanguage element.
sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLangu.helpDescription: Provides the AstExpressionLanguage service functionality, such as expression validations, expression parsing, auto-complete suggestions, retrieving expression metadata and tokens, and performing runtime services (fetching data objects, outputs, etc).

bindingContextPath.description: Path to a Vocabulary object in the model data, which is used for the definition of relative context bindings inside the Ast Expression Language control (mandatory). Example: "/Vocabularies(Id='0050569181751ED683EFEEC6AA2B73C5')"
bindingContextPath.helpDescription: Path to a Vocabulary object in the model data, which is used for the definition of relative context bindings inside the Ast Expression Language control (mandatory). Example: "/Vocabularies(Id='0050569181751ED683EFEEC6AA2B73C5')"

dataChange.name: dataChange
dataChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration.description: The sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration element provides the ability to define specific properties that will be applied when rendering the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder in decision table mode.
sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TextRuleConfiguration. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableSettings enableSettings} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableElse enableElse} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableElseIf enableElseIf} : boolean (default: true)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration.helpDescription: The sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration element provides the ability to define specific properties that will be applied when rendering the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder in decision table mode.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.
tooltip.helpDescription:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

dragDropConfig.description: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.
dragDropConfig.helpDescription: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

enableElseIf.description: The value determines whether the Else If section is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).
enableElseIf.helpDescription: The value determines whether the Else If section is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

enableSettings.description: The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).
enableSettings.helpDescription: The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

enableElse.description: The value determines whether the Else section is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).
enableElse.helpDescription: The value determines whether the Else section is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

formatError.name: formatError
formatError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

change.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationSuccess.helpDescription: Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model. Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

modelContextChange.name: modelContextChange
modelContextChange.description: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.helpDescription: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage.description: Provides the ExpressionLanguage service functionality, such as expression validations, expression parsing, auto-complete suggestions, retrieving expression metadata and tokens, and performing runtime services (fetching data objects, outputs, etc).
sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage.constructorDescription: Constructor for a new ExpressionLanguage element.
sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage.helpDescription: Provides the ExpressionLanguage service functionality, such as expression validations, expression parsing, auto-complete suggestions, retrieving expression metadata and tokens, and performing runtime services (fetching data objects, outputs, etc).

valueHelpCallback.description: The valueHelpCallback is a function that receives by reference an array of value help metadata and adds to each item an OData model instance. The OData model is used for suggesting allowed values and for validating values that are used in the rule.
valueHelpCallback.helpDescription: The valueHelpCallback is a function that receives by reference an array of value help metadata and adds to each item an OData model instance. The OData model is used for suggesting allowed values and for validating values that are used in the rule.

bindingContextPath.description: Path to a Vocabulary object in the model data, which is used for the definition of relative context bindings inside the Expression Language control (mandatory). Example: "/Vocabularies(Id='0050569181751ED683EFEEC6AA2B73C5')"
bindingContextPath.helpDescription: Path to a Vocabulary object in the model data, which is used for the definition of relative context bindings inside the Expression Language control (mandatory). Example: "/Vocabularies(Id='0050569181751ED683EFEEC6AA2B73C5')"

dataChange.name: dataChange
dataChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration.description: The sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration element provides the ability to define specific properties that will be applied when rendering the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder in decision table mode.
sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DecisionTableConfiguration. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCellFormat cellFormat} : sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableCellFormat (default: Both)
    • {@link #getHitPolicies hitPolicies} : sap.rules.ui.RuleHitPolicy[] (default: FirstMatch,AllMatch)
    • {@link #getEnableSettings enableSettings} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDecisionTableFormat decisionTableFormat} : sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableFormat (default: CellFormat)
    • {@link #getThreshold threshold} : int (default: 30)
    • {@link #getVisibleRowCount visibleRowCount} : int (default: 30)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration.helpDescription: The sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration element provides the ability to define specific properties that will be applied when rendering the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder in decision table mode.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.
tooltip.helpDescription:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

dragDropConfig.description: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.
dragDropConfig.helpDescription: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.

decisionTableFormat.description: The value determines whether the user can set the rendering of the decision Table to be based on cellFormat or rule Format
decisionTableFormat.helpDescription: The value determines whether the user can set the rendering of the decision Table to be based on cellFormat or rule Format

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

cellFormat.description:
Deprecated! Since undefined This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the decisionTableFormat property.
The value determines the user input mode for the corresponding rule cells when creating or editing a rule.
cellFormat.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since undefined This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the decisionTableFormat property.
The value determines the user input mode for the corresponding rule cells when creating or editing a rule.

DeprecatedInfo.description: This attribute is deprecated since version 1.52.8, use the decisionTableFormat property.

visibleRowCount.description: Number of visible rows of the table.
visibleRowCount.helpDescription: Number of visible rows of the table.

enableSettings.description: The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a decision table when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).
enableSettings.helpDescription: The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a decision table when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

threshold.description: The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load.
threshold.helpDescription: The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

hitPolicies.description: The value determines how the results of the decision table are evaluated when more than one rule is matched for a given set of inputs.
hitPolicies.helpDescription: The value determines how the results of the decision table are evaluated when more than one rule is matched for a given set of inputs.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

formatError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
